Abstract: At the Cannes Film Festival, the filmmaker Carlos Reygadas defends his film “Post Tenebras Lux” after boisterous boos greet one screening.
Snippet: At the Cannes Film Festival, the filmmaker Carlos Reygadas defends his film “Post Tenebras Lux” after boisterous boos greet one screening.
LeadParagraph: CANNES, France — At 40, Carlos Reygadas is firmly established as the leading enfant terrible of Mexican cinema and a favored son of the Cannes Film Festival. All four of his features, starting with his 2002 debut, “Japón,” have been shown here; on his previous trip, in 2007, he won the Jury Prize (the equivalent of third place) for the Dreyer-inspired “Silent Light.”

Headline.Main: Cannes Film Festival: Loud Boos Don’t Faze Carlos Reygadas
